item.title: Social norms valued in 2018 remain important today: Expert
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Removing stagnant water to prevent mosquitoes from breeding is regarded as the most desired social norm by Singaporeans, followed by refraining from spitting or littering.

item.title: Striving to stay relevant as host of regional conferences
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy's (LKYSPP) Asia Thinker Series - its thought leadership forums with academic experts, policymakers and business leaders - was launched as an online event in March.

item.title: Trial on SCDF ragging death ends; verdict out in July
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The trial of two Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF) officers allegedly involved in a 2018 ragging incident, in which a national servicemen drowned in a pump well, closed last Friday, with the court set to deliver its verdict on July 10.

item.title: Art gallery turns to virtual studio tours and exhibitions
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

From a studio tour by Miami-based German sculptor Rainer Lagemann to a virtual exhibition hosted by Chinese artist Wu Qiong, homebound art lovers have been getting an inside look at the creative process, thanks to an initiative by local art gallery Ode to Art.

item.title: More firms turn to 'pay now, work later' practice to avoid cuts
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Her friends had their salaries cut or were laid off amid the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Zouk to set up eatery, rent out club for live streaming
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

What was once one of the most crowded nightspots in Singapore has sat empty for more than two months with no end to the shutdown in sight.

item.title: First imported case since May 10 came here for unrelated treatment
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A Bangladeshi man who came to Singapore to seek medical treatment that was not related to Covid-19 later tested positive for the coronavirus, making him the first imported case here since May 10.

item.title: Doc sued for breaching exclusive relationship
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A woman is taking a doctor to court in a case believed to be the first here of a person suing another for allegedly promising they would have an exclusive relationship when he had no intention of keeping his word.

item.title: Public servant held for allegedly leaking classified info on phase two changes
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A public servant has been arrested for allegedly leaking classified information to the public on the resumption of activities in phase two of the reopening of the Singapore economy before it was officially released.

item.title: More keen to make wills amid pandemic
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Madam Jamaliah Jamaludin drew up her will earlier this year as she was "not getting any younger" and life, she said, was fragile.

item.title: Back to dorm after Covid-19 recovery
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

IfÂ  Westlite Toh Guan sounds familiar, that is likely because it was one of the first two dormitories to be gazetted as an isolation area back in early April. It was an early sign of the spread of Covid-19 among Singapore's migrant workers.

item.title: Great Eastern raises $265k for three charities
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Employees at Great Eastern (GE) have dug deep to raise $265,000 to fund charities helping people affected by the pandemic.

item.title: Uniqlo donates innerwear to keep healthcare workers cool
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Japanese clothing company Uniqlo is donating 10,000 pieces of its Airism innerwear to help keep healthcare workers cool while they work in protective gear.

item.title: Sisters create website to help those in need
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Concerned about the impact of the coronavirus crisis on the needy and vulnerable, two siblings decided to pitch in.

item.title: A mother's love blooms in adversity
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Years ago, when I was expecting my first child, I came across a Hallmark card for Mother's Day while browsing at the bookstore. "The day you become a mother is the day you start watching your heart walk around your body," it cooed.

item.title: S'poreans will be able to improve their lives at every career stage
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporeans will have opportunities to improve their lives at every stage of their careers, no matter how old they are, Minister for Trade and Industry Chan Chun Sing said yesterday, pledging that the Government would always help Singaporean workers.

item.title: Online sports betting resumes in S'pore today
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Online sports betting will resume in Singapore today, while punters can bet online on overseas horse races from Wednesday, said Singapore Pools yesterday evening.

item.title: Community adapted well despite Hari Raya challenges: Maliki
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Traditional Hari Raya festivities may have been cancelled this year because of Covid-19, but the Malay-Muslim community here has adapted admirably and found opportunity amid adversity, said Senior Minister of State for Defence and Foreign Affairs Maliki Osman.

item.title: Restaurant owners serve up free meals for hospital workers
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

After a long day of caring for patients, nurse clinician Amy Ong is looking forward to a bowl of spicy kung pao chicken, salmon, vegetables and capsicum omelette.

item.title: Fashion retailer FJ Benjamin launching online-only labels
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

When the coronavirus pandemic forced fashion retailer FJ Benjamin to temporarily shut its nearly 300 stores in Singapore, Malaysia and Indonesia, falling back on online sales was not an option.

item.description:

Construction worker Arockia Rajan Sasi, 32, uses his mobile phone to scan a SafeEntry QR code posted outside a third-floor Housing Board unit in Yishun to log his entry into his workplace.

item.title: Online sports betting resumes today
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Punters will be able to place bets online on sporting events from today, with Singapore Pools announcing it is gradually resuming services.

item.title: DBS staff to befriend 1,000 seniors virtually to boost morale
item.description:
June 15, 2020 5:00 AM

One thousand senior citizens, who are mostly living in rental flats, will be interacting with a similar number of DBS Bank employees in virtual befriending sessions next month and in August.
